intro: Eriostax glauca, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, blue-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and pine flatwoods. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, producing small, white to blue florets that attract pollinators. Eriostax glauca is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native landscapes.
